quotes.t: In this case, the filmmakers did not prevent information from being {qword}disseminated{/qword}. And they have no greater moral obligation than do the highly paid Tom Brokaw or Dan Rather to help a TV network keep down its costs.

He told me that as Commanding General [General David Petraeus] he believes he should not only direct battlefield action but also {qword}disseminate{/qword} a few easy-to-grasp concepts about the war's prosecution, which subordinate officers can then interpret on their own.
Jefferson helped found and back a friendly newspaper, the {it}National Gazette{/it}, to help {qword}disseminate{/qword} his views.

Although possession of virus software and source code is not illegal, many of the existing state and federal computer intrusion and unauthorized access laws already make it illegal to introduce a virus into someone's system intentionally. Robert Morris's conviction … shows how the existing laws might be used to punish those involved with {qword}disseminating{/qword} viruses.

et: Latin {it}disseminatus{/it}, past participle of {it}disseminare{/it}, from {it}dis-{/it} + {it}seminare{/it} to sow, from {it}semin-, semen{/it} seed {ma}{mat|semen|}{/ma}
shortdef: to spread abroad as though sowing seed
